attributes.action: All prime minister's should be voted by the electorate not the privileged few
attributes.additional_details: We need to change the rules to stop changing prime minister's during a parliamentary term without a full public vote. The rules as they stand allow any political organisation to do this. The only exceptions to allow the current rules would be death or resignation due to serious health condition
attributes.background: To change the rules regarding the prime minister being allowed to be selected by a privileged few during a parliamentary period where the electorate have no say. These are public servants who are put in office after a public vote

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620016

If what you want is for the Prime Minister to be directly elected, we could accept a petition requesting this.
